instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.P3V3S4_EN: What is P3V3S4_EN? P3V3S4_EN is a signal that enables the PP3V3_S4 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: Mac <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> 0.1v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_FET_R</SIGNAL> is missing on <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>... <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> Bad?

Edit: Reflowed <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> now i got 1.1v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>

threads.title: Mac <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>3V3_S4_FET</SIGNAL>?
If OK and also =<SIGNAL>P3V3S4_EN</SIGNAL> is present, then change <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>.
If no good, check disconnecting RIO power connector and trackpad flex.

threads.title: Mac <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
threads.message:
Diode mode <SIGNAL>3V3_S4_FET</SIGNAL> 0.104

It's strange now i get IN and OUT voltage on <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>.

all measured just board plugged in

threads.message: Wait, your board has non working TP/KB or is not starting at all???

threads.title: Mac <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
threads.message: The board was powering on and now All magically started working trackpad and keyboard... testing now but all seems good :D Thanks 2informaticos

threads.title: Mac <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
threads.message: Clean both terminals of TP flex, as its connectors too.
